title: Roasted Beets with Walnuts
summary: Roasted Beets with Walnuts might be just the side dish you are searching for. This caveman, gluten free, primal, and whole 30 recipe serves 6 and costs $1.4 per serving. One portion of this dish contains about 6g of protein, 34g of fat, and a total of 363 calories. 1 person were glad they tried this recipe. If you have balsamic vinegar, walnuts, salt, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 2 hours. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 61%. This score is solid. Try Zinfandel Risotto with Roasted Beets and Walnuts, Roasted Beets with Citrus, Fetan and Walnuts, and Roasted Beets with Goat Cheese and Walnuts for similar recipes.
instructions: Instructions                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Position a rack in the center of the oven and preheat the oven to 400F.                                                     Wrap each beet separately in aluminum foil. Place on a baking sheet and bake until the beets feel somewhat tender when squeezed, about 1 hours.                                                     Unwrap the beets. To peel, working one at a time, impale a hot beet at the stem end on a fork. Using a small knife, pare off the skin and then cut the beet into -inch-thick rounds. Transfer the beets to a serving bowl. Add the walnuts, oil, and vinegar, and mix gently. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                var articleType_27_data = {};                    articleType_27_data.init_step_by_step_images = 0;

steps.step: Position a rack in the center of the oven and preheat the oven to 400F.
Wrap each beet separately in aluminum foil.
Place on a baking sheet and bake until the beets feel somewhat tender when squeezed, about 1 hours.
Unwrap the beets. To peel, working one at a time, impale a hot beet at the stem end on a fork. Using a small knife, pare off the skin and then cut the beet into -inch-thick rounds.
Transfer the beets to a serving bowl.
Add the walnuts, oil, and vinegar, and mix gently. Season with salt and pepper.
